citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
* APHIS Form 7002- Program of Veterinary Care was incomplete. The portion containing preventative care and
maintenance for : hair coat, nails, eyes, ears, skin and teeth was not available for review. The Program of Veterinary Care
is a required document that provides a clean line of communication between the licensee and the attending veterinarian
with regard to the care of the dogs and puppies (33 dogs, 12 puppies). The licensee must ensure that the Program of
Veterinary Care is updated and followed as advised by the attending veterinarian and available for review by the inspector
upon request.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
b)(2) Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs and cats must be sanitized at least once every 2
weeks using one of the methods prescribed in paragraph (b)(3) of this section, and more often if necessary to prevent an
accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards.
Six outdoor dog pens (containing 18 dogs) have a build up of dirt, fecal waste and bedding embedded in the crevices of
the enclosure. This build up can soil the dogs and increase the likelihood of odors, pests and other disease hazards.
Licensee must ensure that enclosures are cleaned daily, sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and more often if
necessary to prevent accumulations of dirt, debris, waste and other disease hazards for the health and well being of the
dogs.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by March 30, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
* APHIS Form 7002- Program of Veterinary Care was incomplete. The portion containing preventative care and 
maintenance for : hair coat, nails, eyes, ears, skin and teeth was not available for review. The Program of Veterinary Care 
is a required document that provides a clean line of communication between the licensee and the attending veterinarian 
with regard to the care of the dogs and puppies (33 dogs, 12 puppies). The licensee must ensure that the Program of 
Veterinary Care is updated and followed as advised by the attending veterinarian and available for review by the inspector 
upon request. 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
b)(2) Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs and cats must be sanitized at least once every 2 
weeks using one of the methods prescribed in paragraph (b)(3) of this section, and more often if necessary to prevent an 
accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards. 
 
Six outdoor dog pens (containing 18 dogs) have a build up of dirt, fecal waste and bedding embedded in the crevices of 
the enclosure. This build up can soil the dogs and increase the likelihood of odors, pests and other disease hazards. 
Licensee must ensure that enclosures are cleaned daily, sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and more often if 
necessary to prevent accumulations of dirt, debris, waste and other disease hazards for the health and well being of the 
dogs. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by March 30, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n
